wikipedia_page.main: Herbert Frood (1864 - 1 May 1931) was an English inventor, industrialist, and entrepreneur.  He is known for being the inventor of brake pads.

response: Ferodo is in Chapel-en-le-Frith, who have made brake pads since its founder Herbert Frood invented them in Combs in 1897. * Herbert Frood (1864–1931), English inventor, industrialist and entrepreneur

Brake linings were invented by Bertha Benz (the wife of Karl Benz; Karl invented the first patented automobile) during her historic first long-distance car trip in the world in August 1888, when she ordered a shoemaker to nail leather onto the brake blocks. The first asbestos brake linings were developed in 1908 by Herbert Frood.T.P. Newcomb and R.T. Spurr, A Technical History of the Motor Car (Bristol/New York: Adam Hilger, 1989) Although Frood was the first to implement the use of asbestos brake linings, the heat dissipation properties of the fibres were tested by various scientists, including well known materials chemist Dr Gwilym Price, who did most of his research and testing from Cambridge, United Kingdom and various Cambridge-funded institutes.
Combs resident Herbert Frood developed a vehicle brake pad and in 1897 founded the company Ferodo. The village was also home to journalists and authors Crichton Porteous and Peggy Bellhouse.
